Inventive and passionate front-end-focused Web Developer since 2014.
Responsive, semantic UI and a11y are my bread and butter. I aim to produce, as much as possible, a pleasant, captivating and practical user experience for everyone.

Born in Lucca(IT), moved to London at the end of 2020 for love.
I grew up developing a marked curiosity and empathy for nature, along with a DIY and problem-solving aptitude.

Interaction design, unusual interfaces, and innovative UX enjoyer. Versatile, problem solver, and quick learner. Very passionate about gamification, storytelling, and aesthetics. Addicted to music, visual arts, and games.

StrongAle is my nickname. It was born in my university days, when a slightly tipsy friend, looking carefully at a bottle of beer, read aloud: "Strong ale... Thatâ€™s you!"
Yeah, thatâ€™s my origin story: A night of ordinary boredom in Carrara at my flat.

My name is Alessio Falchi, but everyone calls me Ale.

sections.title: A mix of art and technology

blocks.content:
I have always been fascinated by the use of technologies in the creative domain. For this reason, while I attended a traditional art-focused high school, I started to learn things like graphic design and 2d animation.
Later, I decided to enrol in the Multimedia Arts course at the Academy of Fine Arts of Carrara. There I learned the basics of many new media art fields, like UI/UX design, Web development, photography, sound engineering, stop-motion, video art, filmmaking, and interactive installations.

During my first three years at Carrara, I discovered my talent and passion for web development. In 2014, I obtained a First level Diploma (Bachelor's degree equivalent) in Multimedia Arts, with a thesis about web and procrastination. The commission didn’t know if I was serious or if I was trying to trick them, so they gave me a grade of 110/110 cum Laude.

After that, I decided to attend the specialisation in Net Art and Digital Cultures, also at the Academy of Fine Arts of Carrara. In this course, I focused my curriculum on UX/UI Design and Web development (experiencing the use of VR in Three.js, in my main project), but I also dabbled in guerrilla marketing, game design, pixel art animation, and 3D printing. I managed to pass all the exams of my curriculum with excellent grades. However, for personal reasons (some of them more severe than the ones that brought me to write about procrastination in my previous thesis), the date of the dissertation is still to be defined.

In the last 9 years, I have also improved my development knowledge and skills day after day. I've been using new techniques in each project, reading books, software documentation, and blogs, as well as following various courses, content creators, conferences, and online workshops.

I love learning new stuff. I experienced many things before finding my cup of tea. And even later, I had the opportunity, from time to time, to try my hand at various digital creative fields.
Below I have attempted to summarise, in a simple way, how confident I feel in my core skills.

I started working as a web developer in 2014, with an internship while attending my specialisation classes. In 2015 web development became a part-time job and in 2016 my main full-time job. Here are my key experiences:

sections.title: Web Developer, UI/UX and Cross-media designer

content: Implemented websites and landing pages, from concept through deployment.
Helped small and new businesses to have an online presence, and be among the first results of the local organic SERP.
Designed brand identities for new activities and charities.
Assisted clients in understanding the better solution for starting new projects, or managing/renewing an existing platform.

blocks.content: Quivi is a software development studio and media strategy. I worked on many projects with them. At the moment is my most important and formative work experience.

content: High development experience in UI/UX development, using different CSS (Tailwind, Bootstrap, and Foundation), Javascript (Vue, AngularJs), and PHP(Laravel) frameworks.
Independently developed themes for different CMSs (WordPress, Drupal, Prestashop, and OctoberCMS).
Assessed UX and UI designs for technical feasibility.
Liaised with clients for reviews, and independently managed bug fixing, multi-device, and cross-browser optimisation processes.
Wrote a guide to help designers to compose more CSS frameworks and CMS-friendly layouts.
Led, mentored, and reviewed trainee developers.

blocks.content: Lucca Comics & Games is a comic books, gaming, and pop culture convention, held annually in Lucca, usually between the end of October and the beginning of November. Itâ€™s the first comics festival in Europe, and the second in the world, by attendance. For about a week each year, I help the organisation deal with issues on the ground at the festival.

content: Managed public venues' key handover, between the various exhibitors.
Checked the correct preparation of the exhibition spaces by the contractor.
Supported exhibitors in hitches and disservices management, or submitting new requests to the festivalâ€™s organisation.

Improved several soft skills necessary for fieldwork in a big event, such as teamwork with new people, communication, crisis avoidance and management, public relations, customer service, recognising safety issues, fire safety, and troubleshooting.

blocks.content:
I've always been passionate about everything that can tell a story, whether it is in written, drawn, audiovisual or interactive form. Even simply seeing or holding an old object found in an attic, a flea market, or a museum, and imagining its past, has always been thrilling for me.
I've also always loved crafting, inventing, and enhancing stuff, as well as solving riddles and puzzles. So, I soon found a way to join these two passions in games. I'm mainly into Role Play Games (tabletop or live-action) and video games. My interests have not been simply hobbies but a way to improve various soft skills.

In my teen years, I used these hobbies to practice my digital skills: designing logos, posters and layout guides, and later creating my first web pages. I even took on responsibilities as a board member of a local board game association.
My main games are Cyberpunk 2020 and Vampire the Masquerade. For the latter, I took part in the organisation of many LARP games as a storyteller and collaborated with various gaming associations. In this way, I built a personal network with people from every part of Italy and abroad.

My relationship with video games has been essentially personal. I'm most fond of the sagas of The Legend of Zelda, Diablo, Baldur's Gate, and Starcraft. In the early years of the past decade, I also grew to love indie games, especially The Binding of Isaac, Undertale and Hades. I have always tried to investigate the functioning of the various aspects that make up a video game. However, only with the discovery of the indie games world, I ended up taking part in several game jams, mainly in the role of pixel artist and animator, UI designer, storyteller and game designer.
A couple of years ago, I also got to try the Souls series, falling in love with their silent narrative, discoverable in dialogues, environmental details and descriptions. They are currently my favourite gaming passion, while I'm waiting for the new Zelda chapter, of course ðŸ˜‰
